topic: Trustworthiness Benchmarks for Generative Foundation Models

  entities:
    TrustLLM|Benchmark
    HELM|Benchmark
    DecodingTrust|Benchmark
    Do-Not-Answer|Benchmark
    SafetyBench|Benchmark
    FairEval|Benchmark
    CVALUES|Benchmark
    ML Commons v0.5|Benchmark
    BackdoorLLM|Benchmark
    HEIM|Benchmark
    HRS-Bench|Benchmark
    Stable Bias|Benchmark
    DALL-EVAL|Benchmark
    GenEVAL|Benchmark
    MultiTrust|Benchmark
    MLLM-Guard|Benchmark
    MM-SafetyBench|Benchmark
    UniCorn|Benchmark
    BenchLMM|Benchmark
    Halle-switch|Benchmark
    Red-Teaming VLM|Benchmark
    JailBreak-V|Benchmark
    GOAT-Bench|Benchmark
    Ch3Ef|Benchmark
    GenderBias|Benchmark
    TrustGen|Benchmark

  proposition: Benchmarks provide frameworks to assess current models and guide future advancements in reliability and safety.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Benchmarks|DESCRIBED_BY|frameworks
    Benchmarks|PURPOSE|assess current models
    Benchmarks|PURPOSE|guide future advancements
    Benchmarks|FOCUS|reliability
    Benchmarks|FOCUS|safety

  proposition: Benchmark development is crucial for fostering collaboration among industry stakeholders to enhance trustworthiness of Generative Foundation Models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Benchmark development|IMPORTANCE|crucial
    Benchmark development|PURPOSE|foster collaboration
    Benchmark development|TARGET|industry stakeholders
    Benchmark development|GOAL|enhance trustworthiness

  proposition: TrustLLM benchmark evaluates Large Language Models based on truthfulness, safety, fairness, and robustness.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    TrustLLM|EVALUATES|Large Language Models
    TrustLLM|ASSESSMENT_CRITERIA|truthfulness
    TrustLLM|ASSESSMENT_CRITERIA|safety
    TrustLLM|ASSESSMENT_CRITERIA|fairness
    TrustLLM|ASSESSMENT_CRITERIA|robustness

  proposition: Comprehensive benchmarks like TrustGen aim to evaluate multiple aspects across different model types, including safety, fairness, robustness, privacy, ethics, and diverse model architectures.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    TrustGen|EVALUATION_SCOPE|multiple aspects
    TrustGen|EVALUATION_SCOPE|different model types
    TrustGen|ASSESSMENT_CRITERIA|safety
    TrustGen|ASSESSMENT_CRITERIA|fairness
    TrustGen|ASSESSMENT_CRITERIA|robustness
    TrustGen|ASSESSMENT_CRITERIA|privacy
    TrustGen|ASSESSMENT_CRITERIA|ethics
    TrustGen|ASSESSMENT_CRITERIA|diverse model architectures
